Package demo.projects.sut.mapping.pages

Class ProductQuickViewPage

java.lang.Object
demo.projects.sut.mapping.pages.BasePageComponent
demo.projects.sut.mapping.pages.ProductQuickViewPage
public class ProductQuickViewPage
extends BasePageComponent
Product quick view page. Pop up displayed to user when clicking "Quick view" after hovering on ProductCard's image element.

Demo note: Quick view pop up is displayed in an iframe. Page object implements frame switching logic, where page has a flag for checking whether current quick view's iframe is focused when retrieving the page's elements and switches to "Quick view"'s iframe or default content as needed.

Since this is the only GUI node encapsulating object of the SUT that requires iframe switching the provided solution suffices. However in real life case a more robust and easier to maintain logic of switching iframes should be implemented as follows: 1. Create Enum for currently focused frame, with an enum value for each SUT iframe that requires to be switched to during test run and default content. 2. Encapsulate logic for switching to each frame in a single class such as DriverWrapper or BasePageComponent and store the enum value of currently focused on iframe, default content. 3. Before call to Selenium driver server to retrieve WebElement check whether correct iframe or default content is focused on for WebElement retrieval call. 4. In after each test case hook reset the focused view enum value in object defined in step 2. to default content view.

The check and switch defined in step 3. can be implemented by adding the method call to each WebElement retrieval call as is currently implemented in this "Quick View"'s page object or by AOP by creating an aspect with before advices where for different page object different before advice would be applied.
